info.name: Single Int32 SByte4 FBM [265 Ch]
info.description: I finally figured out how to do this! Integer precision single register side effects really give cool dotted sort of noise I guess, who knew? Operations can be performed on single integer registers while vectorizing fully. Made by Rik Riesmeijer (CC0)

renderpass.code:
void mainImage(out vec4 c, vec2 u) {                          // Single Int32 SByte4 FBM.
    u = 300.0 * (u - 0.5 * iResolution.xy) / iResolution.y;   // Normalize UVs.
    u.x += iTime * 22.0;                                      // Animate UV scroll.
    ivec2 v = ivec2(u);                                       // Pixel position integer coordinates.
    c += c =  vec4(((0x01030508 * v.x - 0x0163F413C * v.y)  * // Packed Pythagorean sines and cosines.
                    (0x0A882424 * v.x - 0x01040C0F0 * v.y)) + // Again with different rotations.
                   ((0x01030508 * v.y + 0x0163F413C * v.x)  * // Again but now for other axis.
                    (0x0A882424 * v.y + 0x01040C0F0 * v.x)))  // Add missing rotations and scales.
                    / 43e8 + 0.5;                             // Normalize values.
}                                                             // Made by Rik Riesmeijer - CC0.
renderpass.name: Image
